column2:
"Harkotan is of two halves made whole.
Black and white, Kuron and Shironia, refusing to coexist."

"The two sides have long been engaged in a seemingly
endless conflict, yet none could recall why they fought."

"One day, exhausted from all the war, the
Kings of Kuron and Shironia considered peace."

"As a symbol of this peace, the Shironian King's
daughter married the son of the Kuronite King.
With that, for a time, war had come to an end."

"Alas, the child they brought into the world was not of black or white, but of ashen grey.
Her body was small and did not grow as Kuronites and Shironians did."

"The Shironian King said the Kuronite Prince was to blame. The Kuronite King
said the Shironian Princess was to blame. And thus, war began once again."

"Even the father and mother fought each other.
The ashen child tried to stop them."
"Indeed, the child would lose her life trying to stop them."

"This brought the Kuronite father and Shironian mother to their senses.
Holding the lifeless body of their ashen child, they prayed to the planet,
offering their lives to resurrect their child."

"The resurrected ashen child wept. As her parents' bodies turned
to ash and slipped through her fingers, she continued to weep."

"From her tears, a river had formed. A river of
eternal tears, separating Kuron from Shironia."

"With that, war had come to an end.
The ashen child had put a stop to it."

"And yet the ashen child continued to pray.
For her parents whose lives had been exhausted with tears.
To prevent her parents' lamentations from taking form."
